recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Fish Curry also known as Meen Curry in Kerala is common household dish. Though the recipe differs in each home, few of the ingredients remain the same. It is best enjoyed with hot dosa or rice.Tamarind juice is added to the curry which gives it a sour taste and coconut brings little sweetness to it. At the same time the dish can be made spicy as per your taste by adjusting the red chilly powder quantity

Fish are rich in protein and study has suggested that adding one portion of fish a week to your diet can cut your chances of suffering a heart attack by half. Fish is thought to protect the heart because eating less saturated fat and more Omega-3 can help to lower the amount of cholesterol and triglycerides in the blood â€“ two fats that, in excess, increase the risk of heart disease.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Marinate fish with salt, turmeric and chilly powder. Keep it in refrigerator, if  marinating overnight.
Heat 2 tsp oil in a pan, fry fish for about 5 mins on one side, flip to the other side and fry for another 5 mins. Keep it aside. Soak tamarind in 1/2 cup warm water for 20 mins for juice extract.

Meanwhile,to prepare ground paste, first, take a kadai\wok\any pan, dry roast coriander powder for 4-5 mins or until it changes its color to light brown. Add chilli powder and roast for another 1 min. In case, pan is very hot, chilli powder may get burnt, so immediately switch off the stove after adding chilli powder. Chilly powder will get roasted due to heat anyways. Add mustard seeds and little water to the above masala, and grind until it forms a smooth paste. Keep it aside.
In the same wok\pan, add 2 tsp of oil, add tomatoes and 1/8 tsp turmeric. Fry till it forms a paste.Add the ground paste. Fry till water evaporates and oil gets separated.
Add  water and tamarind juice. Taste if it has not become too sour, cover and bring it to boil.Add fish and curry leaves, cover and cook for 7-8 mins.
Add coconut and mix slowly. let it cook for 3-4 mins. Switch off the stove.
For seasoning, in a separate pan, add oil, once heated add green chillies and fry until crisp, add onions and fry till its cooked. Add this to fish curry. Enjoy the curry with dosa, roti or rice.

tips.tipDesc: If you want more healthier option, skip the step of frying fish. Instead cook it in the masala itself for additional 5 mins
